translations.name: Revised English Bible
translations.description:
The Revised English Bible (REB) is an update, published in 1989, of the New English Bible of 1970. As with its predecessor, it was (and still is) published by Oxford University Press and Cambridge University Press. The changes remove many of the most idiosyncratic renderings of the New English Bible, moving the REB more in the direction of standard translations such as NRSV or NIV. 
Like the NEB, it is primarily presented to the British and British-educated public, although it has some American users and admirers (as indicated by the sales of it within the United States). The REB is one of the versions authorized to be used in services of the Episcopal Church. Other churches in the Anglican Communion also use this version liturgically.
